programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Analyzing the college football landscape in relation to the College Football Playoff, an expert panel speculates on the top four teams in the nation during the current week and predicts how the remainder of the season will unfold.

programme.title: 2024-25 College Football Playoff
programme.desc: No. 6 seed Ohio State (13-2) beat Texas, 28-14, and beat the Fighting Irish last season, 17-14; No. 5 seed Notre Dame (14-1) made it 13-straight wins with a 27-24 win over Penn State, and makes its first championship appearance since 2012.

programme.title: 2024-25 College Football Playoff
programme.desc: No. 6 seed Ohio State (13-2) beat Texas, 28-14, and beat the Fighting Irish last season, 17-14; No. 5 seed Notre Dame (14-1) made it 13-straight wins with a 27-24 win over Penn State, and makes its first championship appearance since 2012.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: AT&T Pregame Showcase
programme.desc: Chris Fowler and Kirk Herbstreit offer their final analysis before kickoff of the CFP National Championship between Ohio State and Notre Dame, breaking down their key players to watch and what each team will need to do in order to win.

programme.title: Ram Trucks Pregame
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming College Football Playoff game, breaking down the key players to watch on both teams who could determine the outcome, the latest injury reports leading up to kickoff, and their predictions on who wins the game.

programme.title: College Football Final

programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Football Playoff game, breaking down highlights of the key moments throughout the contest, the significant stats that determined the outcome, postgame interviews with players and coaches, and the trophy presentation.

programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Draft guru Mel Kiper shares his first mock for the 2024 NFL Draft, featuring insightful discussions on why teams selected specific players, highlights from previous college football seasons, and a breakdown of the skillsets of each player.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Grand Rapids claimed a 3-2 victory over Atlanta in the PVF semifinals round on May 15, led by a season-high 54 assists from setter Ashley Evans; outside hitter Claire Chaussee finished with 22 kills from 62 attempts in the postseason win.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Michigan (6-5, 4-4) is 0-3 on the road this season, but won its last three meetings with the Buckeyes after a 30-24 win last season; No. 2 Ohio State (10-1, 7-1) is 7-0 at home this season, and leads the nation in scoring defense, allowing 10.7 ppg.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 8 Penn State won its last five meetings with the Mountaineers after a 38-15 win last season behind 325 passing yards and three TDs from Drew Allar, two to KeAndre Lambert-Smith; West Virginia went 9-4 in 2023, its best finish since 2016.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: 89 Blocks
programme.desc: The players for the East St. Louis High School Flyers football team face exceptional challenges and inspiring triumph during the 2016 season, which helped bring some sense of pride and joy to the complicated, at-risk community in Illinois.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State and West Virginia split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Mountaineers claiming an 84-78 victory in the final matchup on Jan. 27; JJ Quinerly posted 31 points and 6 rebounds for West Virginia in the home win.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Jackie Robinson: Get To The Bag
programme.desc: Celebrating the life and career of the Hall of Famer Jackie Robinson, the documentary showcases highlights from his most prominent moments in the league to his contributions post baseball and the forever impact he has made on the league.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA and Baylor last met on Nov. 18, 2017, where the Bruins claimed an 82-68 victory over the Bears behind 41 combined points from Monique Billings and Jordin Canada; Canada added 13 assists and a rebound for UCLA in the win at home.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Texas and Maryland last met in the 2021 NCAA Sweet 16, where the Longhorns claimed a 64-61 victory over the Terrapins behind 16 points and 11 rebounds from Charli Collier; Celeste Taylor added 15 points and 11 rebounds for the Longhorns in the win.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: San Francisco and St. Louis face off in the first regular season MLB game played in Alabama as the league honors baseball legend Willie Mays and the Negro Leagues; the game will take place at Rickwood Field, the former home of the Birmingham Barons.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.desc: Grand Rapids claimed a 3-2 victory over Atlanta in the PVF semifinals round on May 15, led by a season-high 54 assists from setter Ashley Evans; outside hitter Claire Chaussee finished with 22 kills from 62 attempts in the postseason win.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State and West Virginia split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Mountaineers claiming an 84-78 victory in the final matchup on Jan. 27; JJ Quinerly posted 31 points and 6 rebounds for West Virginia in the home win.
